metadata.title: CVE-2019-14491 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenCV before 3.4.7 and 4.x before 4.1.1. Thereis an out of bounds read in the functioncv::predictOrdered<cv::HaarEvaluator> inmodules/objdetect/src/cascadedetect.hpp, which leads to denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-contrib406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-core406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-dnn406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-features2d406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-flann406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-highgui406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-imgcodecs406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-imgproc406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-java - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-ml406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-objdetect406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-photo406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-shape406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-stitching406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-superres406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-video406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-videoio406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-videostab406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-viz406 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv406-jni - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
opencv-data - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
python3-opencv - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.6.0+dfsg-4').
